snippet: For a fourth consecutive day, Turkey fired artillery into Syria after another Syrian shell landed on the Turkish side of the two countries’ increasingly tense border.
abstract: Turkey fires artillery into Syria for fourth consecutive day after another Syrian shell lands on Turkish side of increasingly tense border; exchange of fire raises concerns that Syrian conflict will spread.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: For a fourth consecutive day, Turkey fired artillery into Syria after another Syrian shell landed on the Turkish side of the two countries’ increasingly tense border.

headline.seo: Turkey Again Fires on Syria After Shell Landed on Its Side of Border
headline.main: Turkey Fires Back at Syria a Fourth Day in a Row
headline.print_headline: Turkey Fires Back at Syria A Fourth Day In a Row

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
